entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @ClareDinnisEA you spoke to @AaronBell4NUL, perhaps you would like to inform him and the residents of Newcastle-under-Lyme why the @EnvAgency‚Äôs technology is so poor? First the monitoring station isn‚Äôt active during the worst weekend. Now your email ‚Äúbreaks‚Äù so we can‚Äôt report.

*This* is why we have a phosphate pollution problem in Herefordshire rivers. Massive pile of chicken muck dumped right next to watercourse. Completely against the farming rules for water. I‚Äôve just reported it to @EnvAgency.  Totally unacceptable.  And not an isolated incident. https://t.co/1l45pAbllG

tweets.text: @WiseBirding @upstarts1979 @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup I've done some digging Chris. Mike Williams from EA is in charge of this project. Jacobs have been responsible for ecology on site and appear to have recommended scrub removal under supervision in May.

@Kimble8313 @EnvAgencyMids And can't hear the TV over my air purifier as it is going ballistic - happy May bank holiday @ClareDinnisEA bet you didn't stick around very long if you were even here at all that is üò° @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off
People can't even eat their tea in own homes because of foul noxious poisonous and corrosive hydrogen sulphide fumes, sickening! @EnvAgencyMids #stopthestink

@suesustainable @MerryAlbright @EnvAgency I guess this is Glyphosate. It would have required a licence from @EnvAgency I believe. Was one issued? One of the little known impacts of Glyphosate is that it increases the phosphate loading of receiving watercourses. There is a case to be made for a ban in these situations.
@upstarts1979 @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup My understanding is that  ultimate responsibility is with Environment Agency

The @EnvAgency calculate that Affinity Water are over abstracting local chalk streams to the tune of about 430 million litres of water per day.

That's almost 10% of the world's total supply of chalk streams degraded for profit.

Let's talk about a clean conscience shall we. https://t.co/J8nQmVNWlv

2/5 Our @EnvAgencyMids #enforcement notice requires the #landfill operator to cap parts of #WalleysQuarry by midnight 30/04/21. 

This is an important milestone but there will be more to do limit odour. 

I saw progress today üëá and discussed next steps with @RedIndustries2 https://t.co/o3V9B20fdG

Off to Cornwall for the bank holiday with your family?  Check out this video from @sascampaigns showing raw sewage going straight into the Gannel Estuary near to Newquay and Crantock beach Shouldn‚Äôt @SouthWestWater be fined? @EnvAgency Cc @DefraGovUK https://t.co/YQAQ0nrVX2
@HelenVi00175623 @StinkStopthe @Kimble8313 @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @Cap_it_off We didn't get one, thought we wouldn't need it, do they work, tonight is horrendous.

@Bigdwazda @PHE_uk @AaronBell4NUL @BBCNews @itvnews @Channel5N @SOPH_C_ We should be giving this child the best chance possible to thrive. Instead he is having to fight and suffer against these landfill gases. This is not the UK. This is a third world country in disguise. @BritMums @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids #stopthestink

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: My kitchen, 2 miles away and up a hill from #WalleysQuarry, in Keele has suddenly been filled with the smell of landfill! @EnvAgencyMids sort it out! This is now a human rights issue! People can't enjoy their own homes. #StopTheStink

It‚Äôs sad when you come to despise your own home, that‚Äôs how I‚Äôve started to feel about it because I feel trapped, suffocated & financially ruined if we try & walk away @Cap_it_off @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA #stopthestink @MattHancock @BorisJohnson @StinkStopthe https://t.co/2kI3CtPMsW

tweets.text:
Up bright and early because the house has, once again, been filled with hydrogen sulfide. Happy bank holiday, everyone! 

#StopTheStink
This Is Disturbing  https://t.co/xdiXnyeBKt

@Tus_M_ @SuzVW @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA Do you happen to know whether calls are recorded and complaints logged? I will, of course, report via phone from now on but I want a record so I'll keep sending emails too üôè

@a_merrydew @SuzVW @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA Please continue to report via phone if you can -  this is the official advice. üëáIf not save your email and send once the system is back up. Isn‚Äôt it funny how these issues always happen on a weekend. #stopthestink https://t.co/XZ3wjNhNDW

@SuzVW @Tus_M_ @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA My emails have been bouncing back lately so I rang up this morning. I asked how long the email will be down and was told it *should* be working by the end of today. I was given another email address; however, the email address has not been changed on their website...

@SianieRoo @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @BorisJohnson @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe Time to evacuate us all to where the air isn't toxic, don't care where or what to just get us clean air, & nights sleep, they don't realise how terrible this poisoning is, our children in UK 2021 deserve better @ClareDinnisEA @BorisJohnson
